results.title: A Busy sort of bloke: Harold Hughan
results.creator_credit: Crafts Council of Australia, Lindsay Frazer, Gillian Armstrong and Australia Council
results.brief_description: The simplicity and charm of the man and his work are portrayed in this film, which shows Harold Hughan at home and at work. He is seen making a platter, and he discusses the objective of his pieces made with clay. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Birth of a monster
results.creator_credit: John Lamond, Ian Crawford and Zanthus Films
results.brief_description: Ocean Digger an off-shore oil drilling rig is the monster - ugly, unwieldy, gigantic, with a mammoth job to do in the off-shore search for oil and gas. Her construction, launching and fitting out at the Whyalla shipyards are shown in detail. Narrated by Terry Norris.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Lamond, Ian Crawford and Zanthus Films

results.title: Behind the switch
results.creator_credit: Neil Howe, Shan Benson and State Electricity Commission of Victoria
results.brief_description: Every switch is a demand for instant electricity. Shows how this demand is met in Victoria. The Latrobe Valley brown coal provides four-fifths of electricity. Shows work at Yallourn and Morwell and progress on the new Hazelwood power station. Use of electricity in industry, at home, for transport, and entertainment. Increasing demands are a measure of the State’s growth and rate of development. Emphasis on ability to meet future demands.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Neil Howe, Shan Benson and State Electricity Commission of Victoria

results.title: Ballads of Bullant Ridge. No. 1
results.creator_credit: Chris Gallagher, Alan Marshall, Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: A series of bush ballad songs based on the “Speewa Jack” characters from the Alan Marshall stories illustrated by cartoonist Douglas Trainsh. The songs are ‘The Strongest man in town’; ‘The Boxing kangaroo’; and ‘Goanna oil’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Gallagher, Alan Marshall, Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions

results.title: Angels and acorns: Tasmanian 'colonial' stone carvings
results.creator_credit: Rodney Musch, Lindo Taylor, Norman Laird and Tasfilm Productions
results.brief_description: Illustrates the use of Australian sculpture in Tasmania from its earliest days to the end of the last century. Work of convict origin is shown including Ross Bridge with its notable sculptures and gargoyles. Photographer: Rodney Musch. Commentator: Bert Wicks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rodney Musch, Lindo Taylor, Norman Laird and Tasfilm Productions

results.title: Stories from Birchip
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, Jason White, David Meagher, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Ten stories recorded by ACMI in the Mallee town of Birchip (and one about an Art Deco cinema in nearby Charlton) to celebrate the annual Small Towns summit hosted by Birchip in August 2007. Each film created to be a part of the ACMI MAP (Memory and Place) project is under 7 minutes long and is specifically about relationship to place.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dean Lawry, Jason White, David Meagher, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development

results.title: Ecology and dreams
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: A dream for Lizzie and Shayne to make a difference in our world has become a reality in their little part of it. Together they have established the award-winning Cape Otway Centre for Conservation Ecology.
results.description: A dream for Lizzie and Shayne to make a difference in our world has become a reality in their little part of it. Together they have established the award-winning Cape Otway Centre for Conservation Ecology.
